Author: Seko#7408
Content: Can we use optional Jumblr in BarterDEX? Is it possible to use in HyperDEX, too?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: You need native to use jumblr and hyper only works with lite mode for now so probably not.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Thx Cryptoon, that is the information which I need...

Author: orionXII#1373
Content: Is it possible to use a hardware wallet for storing the funds within HyperDEX / BarterDEX or are they stored in a "wallet.dat" file or something? How and where are they stored exactly... Want to know üòÉ

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Wallet.dat is only generated for native, so only for barterdex

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Iirc hardware wallets use some sort of lite client?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: We encrypt your seed and store it on your machine, similar to how electrum does

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: when you login and enter your password, your seed is decrypted

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so if someone gains access to your machine or your backups, your funds are safe, assuming you have a sufficiently strong password

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: hardware wallet support isn't possible for us to add at the GUI level, but if it's first supported upstream in `marketmaker` it's something we could implement

Author: nii236#2759
Content: Are there any plans to migrate the codebase to TypeScript to avoid common JS gotchas? Might be worthwhile for an app that handles crypto-currencies.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: There are no plans right now, and a full re-write isn't really feasible currently. But we have already run into a few bugs that static typing would have probably prevented so I wouldn't say it's totally out of the question in the future.

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: As a side note. While hyperdex is running, if you grep the process, the key will be in the information returned. I'm just noting this so folks are aware

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: @nii236 Yeah, https://github.com/lukechilds is my personal GitHub account. We set up an Atomic Labs organisation (https://github.com/atomiclabs) and migrated the project there alone with other related projects we're working on.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: And yes, feel free to help out, we have loads of open issues and welcome contributions

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: just comment on an issue if you're planning on taking it on so we can assign it to you so we don't work on it internally too

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
>Just to be on the same page users could experience issues because of their resources , the minimum requirements are the same as Barterdex right?

Technically yeah but the minimum requirements should be pretty low. We do use Electron which can be a bit of a resource hog but I most of todays laptops should be able to handle it fine

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: we don't have any official minimum requirements but if you can run Slack you can run HyperDEX
